content.body:
> <@annevk:mozilla.org> GPHemsley: you have write access

I was unable to merge https://github.com/whatwg/mimesniff/pull/142 because main is a protected branch and I wasn't authorized
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
GPHemsley: you have write access
I was unable to merge https://github.com/whatwg/mimesniff/pull/142 because main is a protected branch and I wasn't authorized

content.body: Do I understand correctly that there are no normative requirements on the user agent style sheet(s) for media documents?
I don't recall seeing any when I last looked, but that was probably five years ago at least
smaug: unless you have an objection to the things presented in https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1009 I'm inclined to merge it as it meets all the criteria as far as I can tell
content.formatted_body: smaug: unless you have an objection to the things presented in https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1009 I'm inclined to merge it as it meets all the criteria as far as I can tell

content.body: GPHemsley: ah, yeah, we have main branch protection, let me add you to the exception list (it's currently empty)
content.formatted_body: GPHemsley: ah, yeah, we have main branch protection, let me add you to the exception list (it's currently empty)

content.body: GPHemsley: status checks are enforced at the moment so any changes will have to go through a PR; reviews are not
content.formatted_body: GPHemsley: status checks are enforced at the moment so any changes will have to go through a PR; reviews are not

content.body: hsivonen: I sometimes wonder if we should make normative requirements on them, at least when they are not top-level or appear in a controlled popup
content.formatted_body: hsivonen: I sometimes wonder if we should make normative requirements on them, at least when they are not top-level or appear in a controlled popup

content.body: annevk: added a comment. I think that is fine addition to DOM, but the performance tests look rather bogus to me, and they seem to mostly test some inefficiency in some particular Range implementation.

content.body: hsivonen: thanks. speculative parsing occurring when there isn't a blocking <script> is new to me
content.formatted_body: hsivonen: thanks. speculative parsing occurring when there isn't a blocking <script> is new to me

content.body: Hmm. I thought that Firefox can start speculative fetching the resources found by non-speculative parsing before the corresponding nodes end up in the DOM, but now that you say that, I need to check if that actually happens.
